comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: No doubt in the Suffrage parade of 10-23-15. "Carrie Chapman Catt (January 9, 1859 – March 9, 1947) was a women's suffrage leader who campaigned for the Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution which gave U.S. women the right to vote in 1920. Catt served as president of the National American Woman Suffrage Association and was the founder of the League of Women Voters and the International Alliance of Women." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrie_Chapman_Catt

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thank for the information artolog. We will add her full name to our catalog record. I believe you are correct about the parade also. It's in between other negatives from that event and she's wearing a sash which says "International Woman's Suffrage Alliance". I'll ask for that to be added to the record also.
